question: My story is that I am a 35 year old insulin dependant diabetic who recently applied for additional life insurance. A profile that listed my medical condition along with a bunch of medicine I am taking and an HIV urine test was submitted. I was rejected for insurance. (I promise I am getting to the HIV part). I am also bi-sexual. I have had about 8 receptive oral sex partners (only 2 actually ejactulated in my mouth) and 12 insertive oral sex partners. I have had protected anal and unprotected anal once each. I asked the guy I had unprotected anal with about his status and he e-mailed me and said he tested negative 1 month before and 3 months after we hooked up. I am unsure about the protected anal partner but I am pretty sure that none of his ejaculate got in me and that the condom was intact ( I saw him take it off in the bathroom and it looked intact). As well the unprotected did not ejaculate in me. I have heard that if directly asked most people will be truthful about their HIV status. This guy seemed trustworthy to me.I am scared shitless to get the results and I am anxious all the time. I can't bring myself to call and get the results. I did ask the results to be sent to my doctor's office but have not heard anything and I am trying to tell myself that no news is good news.My question is1) what do you think my actual risk is?2) Does anyone know anything about requirements for doctors offices to contact you if they recieve a positive result like this?3) I am in Canada and HIV is a notiifable disease here (must be reported to Health Care) does anyone know howthis process works or has been notified like this?Thanks for your replies. I am absolutely paralyzed with fear.Chris
